metadata.synopsis: The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Undercity location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. Pauses - what's that sound? Coming from a secluded area of camp, the angry growl/roar of an animal in distress. (this is Halsin in bear form - anguished, going mad)

33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player rushes towards the sound. They find Halsin, in bear form, his back to us. He turns and ROARS at us, eyes red, spittle flying, rabid. We see beyond him, to Scratch/Yenna lying motionless on the ground.

34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. Pauses - what's that sound? Coming from a secluded area of camp, the angry growl/roar of an animal in distress. (this is Halsin in bear form - anguished, going mad)

28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player rushes towards the sound. They find Halsin, in bear form, his back to us. He turns and ROARS at us, eyes red, spittle flying, rabid. We see beyond him, to Scratch/Yenna lying motionless on the ground.

20.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks back at the motionless victim on the floor, lets out a cry of anguish.

29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
29.text: Oak Father forgive me... I can explain, I swear.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin transforms back to his regular form. He looks sickened, close to death.NodeContext: Saddened, horrified. First part to self, rest to player.

10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
10.text: It's this place. This city. I can feel its corruption eating away at me. I should not be here - no one should be here.

15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
15.text: It has made a monster of me.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I don't understand. What does the city have to do with this?

57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
57.text: It has everything to do with this place. The rot is all around us.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You're an archdruid. Whatever's affecting you, resist it.

38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
38.text: I can't... Whatever powers I have, they are dwarfed by the evil of this place.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: No. You're responsible for your own actions. And you'll have to pay for them as well.

26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
26.text: I shall - trust me. But heed my words. This city is doomed.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: How can you be sure? I feel no such corruption.

21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
21.text: I am an archdruid - every fibre of my mind is attuned to nature. Give it time - you will sense the rot as well.

52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
52.text: Silvanus has abandoned this place. It's nothing but stone, grime, smoke, pain. The trees choke here. The animals hang from butchers' hooks. Nature is dying in the gutter.
52.context: NodeContext: Growing more intense, as if becoming overcome by anger and dark thoughts.

47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
47.text: There is only one god fit to be bowed to in this place. The last god who will ever be knelt before... then all of this will tear itself apart -
47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Halsin cuts off suddenly, racked with a horrible cough. He covers his mouth with his hand. 

We need Halsin standing for this line. Then he coughs at the end of the node, lowering his head a little, covering his mouth with the palm of his right hand. NodeContext: End with a violent cough (coughing up blood)

30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
30.text: My body is trying to fight the corruption... but it's losing. And my mind will succumb soon after.
30.context:
CinematicNodeContext: When he removes his hand from his face, we see he's coughed up blood.

Node starts with Halsin lowering his right hand from his mouth. He holds his hand out in front of him for a moment, revealing that he has coughed up blood. This is while he delivers the VO line. NodeContext: Slightly more lucid, but stricken and fearful

12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin, standing up right in human form, starts to sway, losing his balance. He drops to the ground on all fours. He roars in frustration, still in his human form (Human roar). It is as if he may turn back to a bear at any moment, involuntarily.NodeContext: Bestial groan-roar of pain (human vocals)

18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
18.text: I will not allow it. I will not surrender control. Even in this place, there are still innocents.
18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Halsin, down on all fours, straightens up so that he is kneeling in front of the player. 

He draws a dagger, places the tip of it over his heart, holding it with both hands.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Slap the blade from his hand.

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player lunges forwards, but with uncanny speed of reaction, Halsin flings the blade shooting past the player's ear. The player dodges it, only to see it vanish into smoke. They turn back to Halsin, confused -

1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
1.text: Slow. You'll need to be much, much faster if you want to save the big ox.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly.No dagger, it was thrown away at this point.NodeContext: Taunting

55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
55.text: No. This is how it must be...
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding blade with both hands  at his heart NodeContext: Hasty, resigned

41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
41.text: ...Or is it? Perhaps if you're a little faster, you may yet save the big ox.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the bladefrom his chest both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Think fast. There must be another explanation for this - some way to treat Halsin.

4.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
4.text: Do you think a poultice will unspill your friend's guts? A herbal tea will ungouge his eyes? Try if you like - the time to save him is dwindling fast...
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly. lowering the dagger.NodeContext: Taunting

2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
2.text: I can see your mind at work, my friend. But it's too late. Time to let go...

51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
51.text: Mmm. I feel like a new man. A sharp blade is a true tonic. Your friend will find out for himself, soon enough...
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Wait - this must be Orin's doing. She's compromised our camp.

49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
49.text: So close to grasping the problem, but you fell short all the same. You had better sharpen those wits if you hope to spare your friend the true blade.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly. lowering the dagger.NodeContext: Taunting

24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
24.text: The blood is on my hands, in the end. No more.

36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
36.text: You almost figured it out. But almost won't save your friend. You had better up your game if you hope to truly save him.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with noth hands. He smiles unpleasantly.NodeContext: Taunting

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Lower! Stick it in the guts, not the heart! Make it last!

8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin closes his eyes and RAMS the blade into his guts. He splutters, opens his eyes wide with the pain.

14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
14.text: Did you enjoy the show? It was but an opening act, blood kin.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his belly with both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
6.text: After all you've been through together, you just idly stand by as he pours his heart out for you? Tut tut.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with both hands. He smiles unpleasantly.NodeContext: Taunting

50.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear advances on the player, snarling. The player steps back, braces for an attack - but the bear pauses. His eyes soften.

44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
44.text: Please... wait. I did not want this. I could not stop it.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin transforms back to his regular form. He looks sickened, close to death.NodeContext: Saddened, horrified.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Raise your palms in a peaceful gesture. Try to calm him.

43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out their hands in a placatory, soothing gesture (doesn't make contact).
